theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic regulation of senescence and SASP-driven feedback loops promoting aging and metabolic disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes inflammatory SASP, NF-kB and inflammasome regulation linking senescence to aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in postmitotic neurons with SASP contributing to brain aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on cell cycle arrest, p16INK4 induction, heterochromatin foci, and senescence as a barrier to reprogramming.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights stable proliferative arrest from DNA damage and telomere shortening with SASP driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on autophagy decline with age, its role in preventing senescence, and caloric restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of p16Ink4a-positive senescent cells driving inflammaging via SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details replicative senescence, tumor suppressor activation, telomere shortening as a genetic clock.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence in T cells, telomere shortening, and apoptosis resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links senescent cell accumulation and SASP to immunosenescence, chronic inflammation, and COVID-19 severity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers SASP, inflammation, epigenetics, metabolism converging on senescence and therapeutic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular mechanisms of senescence including cell cycle arrest, SASP, and key signaling pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on skin senescence, SASP, and skin’s role as a systemic aging trigger via secreted factors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescent cell accumulation, SASP, and nuclear/mechanotransduction changes driving systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16INK4a-mediated senescence reducing progenitor proliferation and neurogenesis during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progenitor cell senescence with p16Ink4a, SASP, and impaired remyelination in multiple sclerosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence and Autophagy Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stress-induced premature senescence (SIPS), lysosomal/autophagy dysfunction, and distinct molecular regulators.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as causal driver of aging, SASP effects, and therapeutic senolysis approaches.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Endothelial Cell Senescence and Vascular Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on endothelial cell senescence, SASP, vascular dysfunction, BBB disruption, and cerebrovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Tumor Suppressor and Senescence Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details p53’s role in tumor suppression, senescence induction, and its balance affecting aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin and Histone Variant-Mediated SASP Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on histone variant H2A.J accumulation in senescent cells promoting SASP and inflammatory gene expression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses replicative senescence of fibroblasts as a model linking senescent cell accumulation to organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Senescence and Transcriptional Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA damage accumulation, ATM/ATR activation, and transcription factor networks driving senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction triggering senescence, DNA damage response, SASP, and musculoskeletal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Cell Cycle Arrest Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details replicative senescence in endothelial cells driven by telomere shortening, oxidative stress, and telomere-independent stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP and Metabolic Dysfunction-Driven Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in brain cells, SASP-driven neuroinflammation, and contribution to neurodegeneration.
